attributes.action: introduce legislation to ensure that if the household cleaning costs of female Members of Parliament and the House of Lords is to be covered by the taxpayer so that they can 'do the job properly', then the same facility is offered to all working females who are not MPs but also have the need to 'do the job properly'.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: There is not one jot of difference between a working woman who is an MP and a working woman who is a cleaner in the hotel around the corner.  They both have equal need to 'do the job properly' and therefore if one gets her cleaning costs funded by the taxpayer then they all should.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
